I. City Manager's Agenda

9-0-0

IX. LATE AGENDA ITEMS REQUIRING SUSPENSION OF THE RULES PER RULE 36A
X. LATE RESOLUTIONS TO BE CONSIDERED BY THE CITY COUNCIL
Appended Information
Awaiting Report List
1. AR-16-26 : Report on the possibility of the City Council implementing a zoning change, on the permitting of all new restaurants where a wood-fired oven is used as a significant method of food preparation. On a communication from Councillor Kelley requesting that this matter be forwarded to the 2018-2019 Legislative Session.
2. AR-16-42 : Report on plans for the former Riverside Community Health Center on Western Avenue, including transfer of ownership of the building to the City and the process for determining future usage. On a communication from Councillor Kelley requesting that this matter be forwarded to the 2018-2019 Legislative Session.
3. AR-16-83 : Report on drafting possible legislation and other recommendations for interim actions to identify and address the public health impacts of any commercial wood-fired ovens. On a communication from Councillor Kelley requesting that this matter be forwarded to the 2018-2019 Legislative Session.
4. AR-16-101 : Report on the potential of building below market rental housing on City-owned parking lots along Bishop Allen Drive. On a communication from Councillor McGovern requesting that this matter be forwarded to the 2018-2019 Legislative Session.
5. AR-16-108 : Report on whether people displaced and qualify for Emergency Status who are using Section 8 in other cities or towns can retain their resident preference for the purpose of Inclusionary Housing. On a communication from Councillor Kelley requesting that this matter be forwarded to the 2018-2019 Legislative Session.
6. AR-17-22 : Report on the potential growth of next-generation wireless technology in the City, to include: the expected footprint of citywide coverage from just one company and what market competition might produce; the integration of public and private infrastructure to support the network; what local standards the City might hope to maintain relative to aesthetics and safety; and how this new technology fits into our Broadband access plans. On a communication from Councillor Kelley requesting that this matter be forwarded to the 2018-2019 Legislative Session.
7. AR-17-87 : Report on a schedule for resubmitting a revised draft of the Outdoor Lighting Ordinance that incorporates clearer wording and/or more clearly explains each section in less technical jargon and is more coherent in its entirety, with the goal of seeing such an Ordinance adopted by the end of this City Council term. On a communication from Councillor Kelley and Councillor Devereux requesting that this matter be forwarded to the 2018-2019 Legislative Session.
8. AR-18-6 : Report on information regarding electronic device usage by City-elected officials.
9. AR-18-15 : Report on any other relevant City Department to gain a sense of who is purchasing buildings in Cambridge.
10. AR-18-21 : Report on the feasibility of initiating a formal transit study and action plan of the Alewife area in response to unanimous concerns of the Envision Alewife Working Group.
11. AR-18-37 : Report on the possibility of accepting the City of Boston's invitation to join their intergenerational housing pilot program.
12. AR-18-38 : Report on inventory of all City-owned vacant buildings and lots and the City's plans for them, if any.
13. AR-18-44 : Report on ensuring an additional commitment of $20 million from the City’s budget is devoted over the next five years toward the City’s efforts to preserve and create affordable housing units.
14. AR-18-53 : Report on an updated schedule for resubmitting a revised draft of the Outdoor Lighting Ordinance that incorporates suggestions from the Light Cambridge Committee by June 11, 2018.
15. AR-18-60 : Report on a small business parking pilot that would allow temporary on-street employee parking during typical daytime operating hours.
16. AR-18-61 : Report on commissioning a public art piece, statue, or memorial that would commemorate the dedication of women in Cambridge to passing the Nineteenth Amendment.
17. AR-18-65 : Report on working with the Mayor’s Summer Youth Program and other appropriate City departments to organize a Town Hall Meeting for Cambridge youth.
18. AR-18-66 : Report on establishing a Young Adult Civic Unity Committee to be modeled after the Citizen Civic Unity Committee and to recruit applicants from all across the community and across all socio-economic backgrounds.
19. AR-18-68 : Report on determining the permitting and legality issues of Peer-to-Peer Car Sharing in the City of Cambridge.
20. AR-18-73 : Report on establishing and implementing a dynamic new initiative that will seek to place Port residents (ages 18 and over) on paths to jobs with family-sustaining wages.
21. AR-18-83 : Report on an action plan to work with the City’s Community-Based Organizations to create a network of summertime evening programming to reduce the threat of violence in the City’s public spaces in 2019 and beyond.
22. AR-18-85 : Report on the feasibility of appointing an advisory committee to work through resiliency elements raised during the Envision process and through the Brown petition.
23. AR-18-86 : Report on the feasibility of adopting a policy of replacing any failed 4000K LED streetlights with warmer alternatives as opportunities arise, and offering shielding/filtering upon request from nearby residents whenever possible.
24. AR-18-87 : Report on the navigational editing capabilities of the City of Cambridge.
25. AR-18-90 : Report on the feasibility of establishing a crosswalk at the intersection of Soden Street and Western Avenue.
26. AR-18-91 : Report on drafting a plan that shall allow the Mayor’s Annual Harvard Senior Luncheon to be held regardless of the weather conditions.
27. AR-18-93 : Report on the sale of The Constellation Center's Parcel C in Kendall Square.
28. AR-18-94 : Report on considering to work with consultants and other available resources to help incorporate data access and management concerns into discussions, permits and licenses for new mobility platforms.
29. AR-18-96 : Report on how the City views internet-based platforms as opportunities for outreach and communication and what sort of guidelines have been, or are being, developed to help everyone understand how the City’s various departments do or do not utilize these communication resources and how any communications on these platforms are managed so that the messaging and information is kept up-to-date.
30. AR-18-99 : Report on the creation and implementation of a survey or other feedback mechanism for individuals who have been in contact with the Human Rights Commission. REPORT RECEIVED AND ACCEPTED
31. AR-18-100 : Report on taking all possible immediate actions to preserve and restore Linear Park.
32. AR-18-103 : Report on seeking a formal response from CVS as it relates to a racial profiling incident. REPORT RECEIVED AND ACCEPTED
33. AR-18-105 : Report on the feasibility of placing a condition in the public bidding documents prohibiting municipal contractors from displaying any signage other than company markers and contact information on vehicles. REPORT RECEIVED AND ACCEPTED
34. AR-18-107 : Report on prioritizing the Public Safety outreach measures in the FY20 budget.
35. AR-18-108 : Report on offering early voting in City Council and School Committee Elections.
36. AR-18-114 : Report on opportunities and plans to increase signage or other communication efforts to help ensure that all users of Brattle Street between Eliot and Mason Streets understand the cyclists may be using Brattle Street in the opposite direction of prevailing motor vehicle traffic.
37. AR-18-115 : Report on the current status of the Surveillance Technology Ordinance and a date the City Council can expect an updated version of the proposed Ordinance.
38. AR-18-119 : Report on evaluating the existing capacity of fire stations in the Kendall Square area and whether a new fire station is needed, and if so, determining the feasibility of locating a plot of land for this use.
39. AR-18-122 : Report on the possibility of posting a "no trucks" sign on Hancock Street.
40. AR-18-123 : Report on ensuring funding for our municipal media services.
41. AR-18-127 : Report on providing a timeline when the City Council can expect to receive the draft zoning and public health regulations for urban farming.
42. AR-18-129 : Report on conducting a comprehensive, independent planning, and parking study of the neighborhood and use of the First Street Garage within 6months.
43. AR-18-130 : Report on working with the Chair of the Civic Unity Committee, the Director of the Cambridge Library, the Director of 22-CityView, the Director of the Women’s Commission, and any other appropriate City personnel to begin planning for a public discussion in recognition of 100 Years of Women’s Suffrage.
44. AR-18-132 : Report on the negative traffic impact regarding the Davis Square Neighborhood Plan.
45. AR-18-133 : Report on raising the fines for blocking both loading zones and bike lanes to a comparable rate to Boston for the 2020 fiscal year.
46. AR-18-134 : Report on creating a more inclusive city website, including an Open Meeting Portal registration form that does not require the use of gendered pronouns, salutations or titles.
47. AR-18-136 : Report back on submitting a proposal that candidates would agree to not accept donations from person outside of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts.
48. AR-18-137 : Report on reviewing the FCC Regulations on Small Cell Technology.
49. AR-18-138 : Report on Improving Pedestrian Safety and all relevant traffic calming measures to reduce speeding, implementing different paving surfaces, narrowing traffic lanes, installing pedestrian crossing placards affixed to the ground and adding raised intersections.
50. AR-18-139 : Report on the possibility of planting a substantial-sized tree at the corner of Inman Street and Massachusetts Avenue, directly on the front lawn of City Hall.
51. AR-18-140 : Report on updating the Table of Uses and determining the frequency of regularly updating the Table of Uses.
52. AR-18-141 : Report on safe way to bring power to the curb and across sidewalks to power electric vehicles.
53. AR-18-142 : Report on targeting advertising efforts to education cyclists about riding safely and responsible, sharing the road especially at intersections.
54. AR-18-143 : Report on requiring a business entity's beneficial ownership and residential real estate beneficial ownership transactions be disclosed in all Cambridge real estate transactions.
55. AR-18-144 : Report on the process for obtaining and analyzing further detailed and specific eviction data.
56. AR-19-1 : Report on the recently adopted regulations of the short-term rental revenue and the necessary steps to impose and access the revenue from the excise and community impact fees.
57. AR-19-2 : Report on allocating a percentage of hotel/motel tax revenue and adult use cannabis tax revenue to the arts in the FY20 budget.
58. AR-19-3 : Report on establishing a Central Square Improvement Fund and allocate no less than 25% of funds generated to the arts.
59. AR-19-4 : Report on the City's 1% for arts ordinance, which projects have met the threshold and which have fallen short, and whether it can be adjusted to account for ensuring that all mediums and disciplines of art, including live performance art, receive funding.
60. AR-19-5 : Report on how to provide public representation to the major project Selection Committees.
61. AR-19-6 : Report on outlining how a prolonged Federal Government shut-down may impact the people of Cambridge.
62. AR-19-7 : Report on Boston’s Electric Vehicle Charging Station Home Rule Petition and propose similar language for the City Council to consider.
63. AR-19-9 : Report on determining what facilities, parking changes, and other improvements to the pavement conditions are possible to make Cambridge’s stretch of Webster Avenue a Complete Street.
64. AR-19-10 : Report on establishing a system of information-sharing and/ or alternative method for making available that data which may be of beneficial use to the City in analyzing displacement.
65. AR-19-11 : Report on the feasibility of eliminating the use of plastic water bottles at City and School events.
66. AR-19-12 : Report on the legality and constitutionality of the proposed “Cambridge Publicly Financed Municipal Election Program” and the “Cambridge Municipal Election People’s Pledge.”
67. AR-19-13 : Report on conferring with Eversource and the appropriate City departments to undertake a series of studies and analyses related to finance, health and safety, building design, and long-term electricity needs before the construction of a substation in East Cambridge.
68. AR-19-14 : Report on conducting inventories of both local arts organizations and private foundations that may support them.
69. AR-19-15 : Report on the possibility of setting up an assistance fund/program to help low-income and/or elderly/disabled residents manage bed bug infestations.
70. AR-19-16 : Report on the “Super Sunday” road race that was held on February 3, 2019 and if the proper procedures were followed in issuing permits and when/if the neighbors were notified.
71. AR-19-17 : Report on an update of the status of efforts by MIT's International Center for Air Transportation and MassPort's Community Advisory Committee to study, assess and address noise issues associated with flights in and out of Logan Airport.
72. AR-19-18 : Report on sharing regular project updates from the GSA and MITIMCO on the new Volpe Center.
73. AR-19-19 : Report on the empty tree wells in the Port area and establish a plan for replenishing these throughout the spring season and determine where additional "smart" trash receptacles can be placed throughout the Port.
74. AR-19-20 : Report on seeking additional funding for affordable housing concerns.
Adjournment
